description:
Description:
------------------------

When POST/GET operation is performed on floating IPs extension, the XML response that is obtained, does not contain nesting of tags as in the case of other extensions , for example Keypairs.

Actual Response:
-------------------------

1. POST
curl -i http://10.233.52.237:8774/v2/c87a7dbd7787457ba243b7c22a914f8d/os-floating-ips -X POST -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: ps_project" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" -H "Accept: application/xml" -H "X-Auth-Token: 08de6f52882e43e29ecc7b40da084876"

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<floating_ip instance_id="None" ip="172.24.4.228" fixed_ip="None" id="4" pool="nova"/>rajalakshmi_ganesan@ubuntu:~

RESPONSE WHILE KEYPAIR CREATION
---------------------------------------------------------------

rajalakshmi_ganesan@ubuntu:~/source/csbu-qa/AutomatedTests/python_tests/hp_regression/nova/nova_api_tests/xml$  curl -i http://10.233.52.237:8774/v7a7dbd7787457ba243b7c22a914f8d/os-keypairs -X POST -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: ps_project" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/xml" -H "X-Auth-Token: 85dc0174d8704be79825579e189b7514" -d' {"keypair": {"name": "vijaya1"}}' 

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>

title: Folsom- Nesting of tags is missing for XML response of Floating IP

comments.content:
Description:
------------------------

When POST/GET operation is performed on floating IPs extension, the XML response that is obtained, does not contain nesting of tags as in the case of other extensions , for example Keypairs.

Actual Response:
-------------------------

1. POST
curl -i http://10.233.52.237:8774/v2/c87a7dbd7787457ba243b7c22a914f8d/os-floating-ips -X POST -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: ps_project" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" -H "Accept: application/xml" -H "X-Auth-Token: 08de6f52882e43e29ecc7b40da084876"

comments.content: this is an inconsistency that should be addressed in future versions, but it is not in the scope of the current verison of the api to change the contract. We risk breaking existing implementations.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda
